Reproofs and warnings were sent to both of them, and he always received them. His wife received them too, apparently, but still she continued to 
                                                                           1209
set her table as she chose, irrespective of principle. Their children grew up around them and they saw that their parents' practice of truth was not in accordance with their profession. The mother furnished the table with food which gratified the appetite but which did not properly sustain life. The father was very liberal, too much so in some things, but he did not seem to realize that he must be governed by principle.
